    • Method Detail

      • declareDestinations

        public void declareDestinations(Collection<String> destinationNames)
        Description copied from interface: DestinationFacade
        Declares the given destination names. Among potential pre-fetching of configurations for performance optimizations, declaring destinations is used to ensure that destinations can be retrieved correctly on all supported Cloud platforms when working with non-container managed threads. It should always be invoked before any calls to DestinationFacade.getDestination(String) and DestinationFacade.getDestinationsByName(), for example, during application startup within a ServletContextListener.

        Notes:

        • Implementations must ensure that calls to this methods are idempotent. In particular, declaring a destination multiple times must result in the destination being declared once without any side effects.
        • Declared destinations should not require an existing configuration. However, a missing destination configuration for a declared destination may result in certain warnings being logged.
        Specified by:
        declareDestinations in interface DestinationFacade
        See Also:
        DestinationDeclarator, RequestContext, DestinationsRequestContextListener

        public DestinationType getDestinationType(String destinationName)
                                   throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                          DestinationAccessException
        Description copied from interface: DestinationFacade
        Returns the DestinationType of the destination with the given name.
        Specified by:
        getDestinationType in interface DestinationFacade
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If no destination with the given name can be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getDestination

        public Destination getDestination(String destinationName)
                           throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                  DestinationAccessException
        Description copied from interface: DestinationFacade
        Returns the Destination for the given name.

        Note: The destination must be of type DestinationType.HTTP, otherwise an exception is thrown. You can check the type of the destination with DestinationFacade.getDestinationType(String).

        Specified by:
        getDestination in interface DestinationFacade
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If the Destination cannot be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If the destination is not of type DestinationType.HTTP or there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getRfcDestination

        public RfcDestination getRfcDestination(String destinationName)
                                 throws DestinationNotFoundException,
                                        DestinationAccessException
        Description copied from interface: DestinationFacade
        Returns the RfcDestination for the given name.

        Note: The destination must be of type DestinationType.RFC, otherwise an exception is thrown. You can check the type of the destination with DestinationFacade.getDestinationType(String).

        Specified by:
        getRfcDestination in interface DestinationFacade
        Throws:
        DestinationNotFoundException - If the RfcDestination cannot be found.
        DestinationAccessException - If the destination is not of type DestinationType.RFC or there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getDestinationsByName

        public Map<String,Destination> getDestinationsByName()
                                              throws DestinationAccessException
        Description copied from interface: DestinationFacade
        Returns all known Destinations that are of type DestinationType.HTTP by their names.

        To get all destinations, irrespective of their type, use DestinationFacade.getGenericDestinationsByName().

        Specified by:
        getDestinationsByName in interface DestinationFacade
        Throws:
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.

      • getRfcDestinationsByName

                                                    throws DestinationAccessException
        Description copied from interface: DestinationFacade
        Returns all known RfcDestinations that are of type DestinationType.RFC by their names.

        To get all destinations, irrespective of their type, use DestinationFacade.getGenericDestinationsByName().

        Specified by:
        getRfcDestinationsByName in interface DestinationFacade
        Throws:
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing destination information.
